lines.text: There are times in life when you'd want everything to remain the same forever.
Never force your children to work, otherwise they may get used to it.
People are not used to thinking anymore, but don't do too much of it.
Being free, in short, is not doing nothing, but being the sole decider of what to do or what not to do.
The marsh can still feed a man for a long time. I always had all I needed here and had never been the servant of anyone.
A negro? I don't like that.
Let's go. At night all men are black.

And the green paradise of children's love / The innocent eden, filled with furtive pleasures / Is it now further than India and China? / Can we recall it with plaintive cries? / And animate it with a silvery voice / The innocent eden, filled with furtive pleasures.
